required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Necitumumab and Chemotherapy in Participants With Stage IV Squamous Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Multicenter, Open-Label, Phase 2 Study of Paclitaxel-Carboplatin Chemotherapy Plus Necitumumab (IMC-11F8) Versus Paclitaxel-Carboplatin Chemotherapy Alone in the First-Line Treatment of Patients With Stage IV Squamous Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to evaluate if necitumumab added to standard chemotherapy of paclitaxel and carboplatin is more effective to treat cancer than the standard chemotherapy of paclitaxel and carboplatin alone.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieve Best Overall Tumor Response of Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) (Objective Response Rates [ORR])
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Disease Progression or Death (Up to 24 Months)
primary_outcome.description: The denominator of ORR (Objective Response Rate) includes each participant enrolled who received any amount of study drug (necitumumab, gemcitabine, and/or cisplatin), and who had a complete radiographic assessment at baseline and at least one complete radiographic assessment post-baseline. The numerator includes those participants counted in the denominator with a confirmed best overall tumor response of partial or complete response (Complete Response (CR): disappearance of all non-nodal target lesions, with the short axes of any target lymph nodes reduced to <10 millimeters (mm). Partial Response (PR): at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the diameters of target lesions (including the short axes of any target lymph nodes), taking as reference the baseline sum diameter.) per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) 1.1.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization to Date of Death (Up to 24 Months)
secondary_outcome.description: OS defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause. For participants not known to have died as of the data cut-off date, OS was censored at the last contact date (last contact for participants in post-discontinuation = last known alive date in mortality status).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-infusion Cycle 1, Day 1; Cycle 3, Day 1; Cycle 5; Day 1 (within 2 hours prior to beginning of infusion)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Anti Necitumumab Antibodies

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization to Progressive Disease or Death (Up to 24 Months)
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) is defined as the time from randomization until the first radiographically documented progressive disease (PD) or death from any cause. PD defined by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST version 1.1) as at least a 20% increase in the sum of the diameters of target lesions,taking as reference the smallest sum on study (including the baseline sum if that is the smallest). In addition to the relative increase of 20%, the sum must also demonstrate an absolute increase of at least 5 mm. The appearance of one or more new lesions is also considered progression. For participants not known to have died as of the data cut-off date and who do not have objective PD, PFS will be censored at the date of the last complete radiographic assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieve Best Overall Disease Response of Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR) or Stable Disease (SD) (Disease Control Rate [DCR])
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Progressive Disease and/or Death (Estimated up to 24 Months)
secondary_outcome.description: Defined using the same denominator as defined in ORR. Among participants counted in the denominator, the numerator counts those with a confirmed best tumor response of SD, PR, or CR per RECIST 1.1. (SD: neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD; PR at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameter of target lesions; CR: disappearance of all target lesions).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Progressive Disease or Death (Up to 24 Months)
secondary_outcome.description: CTS is defined as maximum percent change from baseline in the sum of target lesions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1, Day 8 ; Cycle 2, Day 1; Cycle 3, Day 1;Cycle 4, Day1;Cycle 5, Day 1; Cycle 6, Day 1 (within 2 hours prior to beginning of infusion)

clinical_study.condition: Squamous Non Small Cell Lung Cancer

arm_group.description: Necitumumab 800 milligram (mg) administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1 and 8 of every 3 week cycle. Paclitaxel 200 milligram per square meter (mg/m²) administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin Area Under the Curve (AUC)6 (mg•min/mL) administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. The combination of paclitaxel-carboplatin and necitumumab may continue for a maximum of 6 cycles. Necitumumab may continue until Progressive Disease (PD), toxicity requiring cessation, protocol noncompliance, or withdrawal of consent.

Paclitaxel 200 mg/m² administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin AUC=6 administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. The combination of paclitaxel-carboplatin may continue for a maximum of 6 cycles. After completion of chemotherapy, participants will be followed until radiographic documentation of PD.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically or cytologically confirmed squamous NSCLC
- Stage IV disease at time of study entry based on American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) 7th edition
- Measurable disease at time of study entry as defined by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors, (RECIST) Version 1.1
- Archived or recent tumor tissue (minimum of 5 unstained tissue slides or a paraffin-embedded tissue block) available for analysis of epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) protein expression by immunohistochemistry (IHC) and other biomarker assessments
Exclusion Criteria:
- Nonsquamous NSCLC
- Prior anticancer therapy with monoclonal antibodies, signal transduction inhibitors, or any therapies targeting the EGFR, vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF), or VEGF receptor
- Previous chemotherapy for NSCLC
- Major surgery or received any investigational therapy in the 4 weeks prior to randomization
- Chest irradiation within 12 weeks prior to randomization (except palliative irradiation of bone lesions, which is allowed)
- Brain metastases that are symptomatic or require ongoing treatment with steroids or anticonvulsants (Participants who have undergone previous radiotherapy for brain metastases, who are now nonsymptomatic and no longer require treatment with steroids or anticonvulsants, are eligible)

patient_data.ipd_description: Lilly provides access to the individual patient data from studies on approved medicines and indications as defined by the sponsor specific information on ClinicalStudyDataRequest.com. This access is provided in a timely fashion after the primary publication is accepted. Researchers need to have an approved research proposal submitted through ClinicalStudyDataRequest.com. Access to the data will be provided in a secure data sharing environment after signing a data sharing agreement.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A completer is defined as having a complete radiographic assessment at baseline and at least one complete post-baseline radiographic assessment of CR, PR , SD or PD.

group.title: Necitumumab +Paclitaxel+Carboplatin
group.description: Necitumumab 800 milligram (mg) administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1 and 8 of every 3 week cycle. Paclitaxel 200 mg per square meter (mg/m²) administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin AUC6 administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle.

group.title: Paclitaxel + Carboplatin
group.description: Paclitaxel 200 mg/m² administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin AUC6 administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. The combination of paclitaxel-carboplatin may continue for a maximum of 6 cycles.

milestone.title: Received at Least One Dose of Study Drug

group.title: Necitumumab +Paclitaxel+Carboplatin
group.description: Necitumumab 800 milligram (mg) administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1 and 8 of every 3 week cycle. Paclitaxel 200 milligram per square meter (mg/m^2) administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin AUC6 administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle.

group.title: Paclitaxel + Carboplatin
group.description: Paclitaxel 200 mg/m² administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin AUC6 administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. The combination of paclitaxel-carboplatin may continue for a maximum of 6 cycles.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieve Best Overall Tumor Response of Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) (Objective Response Rates [ORR])
outcome.description: The denominator of ORR (Objective Response Rate) includes each participant enrolled who received any amount of study drug (necitumumab, gemcitabine, and/or cisplatin), and who had a complete radiographic assessment at baseline and at least one complete radiographic assessment post-baseline. The numerator includes those participants counted in the denominator with a confirmed best overall tumor response of partial or complete response (Complete Response (CR): disappearance of all non-nodal target lesions, with the short axes of any target lymph nodes reduced to <10 millimeters (mm). Partial Response (PR): at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the diameters of target lesions (including the short axes of any target lymph nodes), taking as reference the baseline sum diameter.) per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) 1.1.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Disease Progression or Death (Up to 24 Months)
outcome.population: All randomized participants that received at least 1 dose of study drug, who had a complete radiographic assessment at baseline and at least 1 complete radiographic assessment post-baseline.

group.title: Necitumumab +Paclitaxel+Carboplatin
group.description: Necitumumab 800 milligram (mg) administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1 and 8 of every 3 week cycle. Paclitaxel 200 milligram per square meter (mg/m²) administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin Area Under the Curve (AUC)6 (mg•min/mL) administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle.

group.title: Paclitaxel + Carboplatin
group.description: Paclitaxel 200 mg/m² administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin AUC6 administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. The combination of paclitaxel-carboplatin may continue for a maximum of 6 cycles.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieve Best Overall Tumor Response of Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) (Objective Response Rates [ORR])
measure.description: The denominator of ORR (Objective Response Rate) includes each participant enrolled who received any amount of study drug (necitumumab, gemcitabine, and/or cisplatin), and who had a complete radiographic assessment at baseline and at least one complete radiographic assessment post-baseline. The numerator includes those participants counted in the denominator with a confirmed best overall tumor response of partial or complete response (Complete Response (CR): disappearance of all non-nodal target lesions, with the short axes of any target lymph nodes reduced to <10 millimeters (mm). Partial Response (PR): at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the diameters of target lesions (including the short axes of any target lymph nodes), taking as reference the baseline sum diameter.) per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) 1.1.
measure.population: All randomized participants that received at least 1 dose of study drug, who had a complete radiographic assessment at baseline and at least 1 complete radiographic assessment post-baseline.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: OS defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause. For participants not known to have died as of the data cut-off date, OS was censored at the last contact date (last contact for participants in post-discontinuation = last known alive date in mortality status).
outcome.time_frame: Randomization to Date of Death (Up to 24 Months)
outcome.population: All randomized participants; (49 and 19 censored participants in Paclitaxel + Carboplatin + Necitumumab and Paclitaxel + Carboplatin Arms, respectively.

group.title: Necitumumab +Paclitaxel+Carboplatin
group.description: Necitumumab 800 milligram (mg) administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1 and 8 of every 3 week cycle. Paclitaxel 200 milligram per square meter (mg/m²) administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin Area Under the Curve (AUC)6 (mg•min/mL) administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle.

group.title: Paclitaxel + Carboplatin
group.description: Paclitaxel 200 mg/m² administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin AUC=6 administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. The combination of paclitaxel-carboplatin may continue for a maximum of 6 cycles.

measure.title: Overall Survival (OS)
measure.description: OS defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause. For participants not known to have died as of the data cut-off date, OS was censored at the last contact date (last contact for participants in post-discontinuation = last known alive date in mortality status).
measure.population: All randomized participants; (49 and 19 censored participants in Paclitaxel + Carboplatin + Necitumumab and Paclitaxel + Carboplatin Arms, respectively.

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of Necitumumab
outcome.time_frame: Pre-infusion Cycle 1, Day 1; Cycle 3, Day 1; Cycle 5; Day 1 (within 2 hours prior to beginning of infusion)
outcome.population: All participants who received at least one dose of necitumumab and had evaluable PK data.

group.title: Necitumumab +Paclitaxel+Carboplatin
group.description: Necitumumab 800 milligram (mg) administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1 and 8 of every 3 week cycle. Paclitaxel 200 milligram per square meter (mg/m²) administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin AUC6 administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. The combination of paclitaxel-carboplatin and necitumumab may continue for a maximum of 6 cycles.

measure.title: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of Necitumumab
measure.population: All participants who received at least one dose of necitumumab and had evaluable PK data.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Anti Necitumumab Antibodies
outcome.population: All participants who received any amount of necitumumab and had post baseline antibody data.

group.title: Necitumumab + Paclitaxel+ Carboplatin
group.description: Necitumumab 800 milligram (mg) administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1 and 8 of every 3 week cycle. Paclitaxel 200 milligram per square meter (mg/m²) administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin AUC6 administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Anti Necitumumab Antibodies
measure.population: All participants who received any amount of necitumumab and had post baseline antibody data.

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival
outcome.description: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) is defined as the time from randomization until the first radiographically documented progressive disease (PD) or death from any cause. PD defined by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST version 1.1) as at least a 20% increase in the sum of the diameters of target lesions,taking as reference the smallest sum on study (including the baseline sum if that is the smallest). In addition to the relative increase of 20%, the sum must also demonstrate an absolute increase of at least 5 mm. The appearance of one or more new lesions is also considered progression. For participants not known to have died as of the data cut-off date and who do not have objective PD, PFS will be censored at the date of the last complete radiographic assessment.
outcome.time_frame: Randomization to Progressive Disease or Death (Up to 24 Months)
outcome.population: All randomized participants; with 15 and 7 censored participants in Paclitaxel +Carboplatin + Necitumumab and Paclitaxel +Carboplatin Arms, respectively.

group.title: Necitumumab +Paclitaxel+Carboplatin
group.description: Necitumumab 800 milligram (mg) administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1 and 8 of every 3 week cycle. Paclitaxel 200 milligram per square meter (mg/m²) administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin AUC6 administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle.

group.title: Paclitaxel + Carboplatin
group.description: Paclitaxel 200 mg/m² administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin AUC6 administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle.

measure.title: Progression-Free Survival
measure.description: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) is defined as the time from randomization until the first radiographically documented progressive disease (PD) or death from any cause. PD defined by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST version 1.1) as at least a 20% increase in the sum of the diameters of target lesions,taking as reference the smallest sum on study (including the baseline sum if that is the smallest). In addition to the relative increase of 20%, the sum must also demonstrate an absolute increase of at least 5 mm. The appearance of one or more new lesions is also considered progression. For participants not known to have died as of the data cut-off date and who do not have objective PD, PFS will be censored at the date of the last complete radiographic assessment.
measure.population: All randomized participants; with 15 and 7 censored participants in Paclitaxel +Carboplatin + Necitumumab and Paclitaxel +Carboplatin Arms, respectively.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieve Best Overall Disease Response of Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR) or Stable Disease (SD) (Disease Control Rate [DCR])
outcome.description: Defined using the same denominator as defined in ORR. Among participants counted in the denominator, the numerator counts those with a confirmed best tumor response of SD, PR, or CR per RECIST 1.1. (SD: neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD; PR at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameter of target lesions; CR: disappearance of all target lesions).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Progressive Disease and/or Death (Estimated up to 24 Months)
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and who had a complete radiographic assessment.

group.title: Necitumumab +Paclitaxel+Carboplatin
group.description: Necitumumab 800 milligram (mg) administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1 and 8 of every 3 week cycle. Paclitaxel 200 milligram per square meter (mg/m²) administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin AUC6 administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle.

group.title: Paclitaxel + Carboplatin
group.description: Paclitaxel 200 mg/m² administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin AUC6 administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieve Best Overall Disease Response of Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR) or Stable Disease (SD) (Disease Control Rate [DCR])
measure.description: Defined using the same denominator as defined in ORR. Among participants counted in the denominator, the numerator counts those with a confirmed best tumor response of SD, PR, or CR per RECIST 1.1. (SD: neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD; PR at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameter of target lesions; CR: disappearance of all target lesions).
measure.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and who had a complete radiographic assessment.

outcome.title: Percent Change in Tumor Size (CTS)
outcome.description: CTS is defined as maximum percent change from baseline in the sum of target lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Progressive Disease or Death (Up to 24 Months)
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and who had a decrease from baseline in the sum of target lesions.

group.title: Necitumumab +Paclitaxel+Carboplatin
group.description: Necitumumab 800 milligram (mg) administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1 and 8 of every 3 week cycle. Paclitaxel 200 mg per square meter (mg/m²) administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin AUC6 administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle.

group.title: Paclitaxel + Carboplatin
group.description: Paclitaxel 200 mg/m² administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin AUC6 administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle.

measure.title: Percent Change in Tumor Size (CTS)
measure.description: CTS is defined as maximum percent change from baseline in the sum of target lesions.
measure.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and who had a decrease from baseline in the sum of target lesions.

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Minimum Concentration (Cmin) of Necitumumab
outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1, Day 8 ; Cycle 2, Day 1; Cycle 3, Day 1;Cycle 4, Day1;Cycle 5, Day 1; Cycle 6, Day 1 (within 2 hours prior to beginning of infusion)
outcome.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug and had evaluable PK data.

group.title: Necitumumab +Paclitaxel+Carboplatin
group.description: Necitumumab 800 milligram (mg) administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1 and 8 of every 3 week cycle. Paclitaxel 200 milligram per square meter (mg/m²) administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin AUC6 administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle.

measure.title: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Minimum Concentration (Cmin) of Necitumumab
measure.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug and had evaluable PK data.

reported_events.desc: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

group.title: Necitumumab +Paclitaxel+Carboplatin
group.description: Necitumumab 800 milligram (mg) administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1 and 8 of every 3 week cycle. Paclitaxel 200 milligram per square meter (mg/m²) administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin AUC6 administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. The combination of paclitaxel-carboplatin and necitumumab may continue for a maximum of 6 cycles.

group.title: Paclitaxel + Carboplatin
group.description: Paclitaxel 200 mg/m²) administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. Carboplatin AUC6 administered IV on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle. The combination of paclitaxel-carboplatin may continue for a maximum of 6 cycles.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Eastern cooperative oncology group performance status worsened

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
